title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
This imac arrived with fan spinning fast and running slow.

memory proximity 2 sensor was at 126C in HW monitor.

Replaced Q5675 but no change. I do not see where else proximity 2 appears in schematic.

What should be checked next?

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
Any history available?
Someone else upgraded from HDD to SSD before get it?

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: No history, just randomly started fast fan spin one day. No SSD upgrades since this came with a fusion drive

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
Test it with USB macOS, to discard a software issue.
Try 2-3 times PRAM reset first.

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: it will only pram reset 2 times in a row. After the second reset fan starts to spin fast before OS even starts loading, internal or external.

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: Not sure why but there was a internal HD sensor installed on main drive but fan still spins fast even with this disconnected.

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
If the sensor is disconnected, fan will spin fast, of course.
Tied to ground pin 11 from SATA SSD connector.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.google.com/imgres?imgurl=https%3A%2F%2Flinustechtips.com%2Fuploads%2Fmonthly_2016_09%2F57d9a2372d5ca_SATAPowerPinout.png.4d3364583a0d2d60c9f8561c37056248.png&imgrefurl=https%3A%2F%2Flinustechtips.com%2Ftopic%2F660662-creating-psu-cables-sata-power-cables%2F&tbnid=R1Yv3bVsAznf3M&vet=12ahUKEwi3m_66xITzAhUDexoKHfwaBTQQMygZegUIARCSAg..i&docid=D4k8BqhSV-3NMM&w=468&h=836&q=sata%20power%20layout&hl=es&client=firefox-b-d&ved=2ahUKEwi3m_66xITzAhUDexoKHfwaBTQQMygZegUIARCSAg[/URL]

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
When the custom sensor is connected or not, the fan spins fast.

Memory proximity 2 128C

HD bay 1 249C

HD bay 2 129C

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: What would you suggest to try next to resolve this problem?

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: Try disconnecting webcam.

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: No change with webcam disconnected

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: Turn it on in diagnostic mode (built in AHT).

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
Turned  it on while holding D key

Afterwards just said there may be a problem with the SMC

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: There should be a specific error message...

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: There may be a issue with the SMC (system management controller) PFM006

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
Check the LCD temp sensor.
Possibly lost contact.

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
Contact on LCD temp sensor looked fine. Disconnected and reconnected just to be sure but still fast fan.

Would you suggest replacing LCD temp sensor next?

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
Replace it, if possible.
Check continuity for its cables/contacts.

Actually, is there any disk attached on SATA port?

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
There is the main 1TB rotational drive and a 128GB SSD drive on the main board. If both are disconnected, fan still spins fast.

Would have to order LCD temp sensor if need exact one , just do not like throwing parts at it when not sure what it is.

Tried a LCD temp sensor from a 21" 2015 LCD but no change either

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: Tied together pins 10/11, or 11/12 on the HDD SATA connector (on the disk directly) and try again connecting it.

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: tried 10/11 and 11/12 but still no change

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
Disconnect SSD and HDD.
Test the machine with USB macOS; to discard a software issue.

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: With SSD and HDD disconnected fan still spins fast even before USB macOS starts to load

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
If you get only one wrong sensor value, should be a problem with that particular sensor.
Check the traces between Q5675 and U5650.
Compare diode mode readings on Q5675 lines qith the ones from Q5680.

Also check Q5670 area, as it is connected in parallel with Q5675.
Should be good to change Q5670 too.

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: Looks like the issue  has something to do with  Q5670. Each time its replaced, the fan works normally for the first 1-3 times the computer runs. After around the 3rd to 4th time its started up from a shut down the fan starts spinning fast again each time pointing to a failed Q5670

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: Replace the parallel capacitors and check traces integrity.

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
Replaced all of parallel capacitors. Traces are fine.

 Afterwards fan worked normally again for about 30 minutes with all sensor values normal. After running about 30 minutes memory module proximity 2 went back to 128c and fan started spinning fast.

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
Machine works correctly if you let it cools down?

Replace Q5670/75 with simple Si diode and check what happens.
Diode must be connected in normal way; anode on the collector pad.

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: What part number could be used to find a simple Si diode? Can it be found on a macbook donar board?

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: Yes machine works correctly if I let it cool down

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
Seems that sensor detects heat increased.
HWMonitor goes directly to 129, or reported temp increases slowly?

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
At first after capacitor and sensor is replaced it will read 28C and run normally but after running about 30 minutes sensor somehow fails goes up to 128C and fan spins fast.

After that letting cool down and boot later fan will be running normal for about 10 minutes but hw monitor goes directly to  128C as soon as you log into OS.  After the 10 minutes even though it said 128C when fan was running normally it will randomly start spinning fast again.

Only way to get it back to 28C again is to replace sensor again.

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
Resoldering the same transistor sensor, doesn't help?
If you change it, starts with normal fan speed, even if board is not cooled down?

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: Resoldering the same one does not help. Yes if changed starts with nornal fan speed at 28C for about 30 minutes then sensor goes fron 28C to 128C and fan revs up shortly after.

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: To be clear, if board cools down, it starts working normal again with the same sensor (not changed)?

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: Yes, it starts working normal again with sensor unchanged after board cools down even though HW monitor reads 128C on that sensor immediately. After the board warms up, the fan will then start spinning fast and the sensor value will remain at 128C at times may go up to 131C

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
Change the caps from the Q5670/75 lines.
In fact, interchange them with ones from other sensors.
Check if get same temp errors after that.

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message:
these caps call for a 2.2PF

caps from other sensors are smaller and do not fit on the pads correctly.

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: I think you can do that for C5654...

title: 820-4652 fast fan
message: Thank you! solved with normal readings  after interchanging C5654/C652 with C5685/C5675
